Frontend.question: What is the difference between <div> and <span> in HTML?
options: div is for inline elements, span is for block elements
div is a block-level element, span is an inline element
span is used for creating new sections
Frontend.answer: div is a block-level element, span is an inline element

Frontend.question: How does CSS Flexbox work?
options: It aligns items along two axes
It is only used for animations
It is an alternative to media queries
Frontend.answer: It aligns items along two axes

Frontend.question: What is the purpose of media queries in CSS?
How does the box model work in CSS?
options: It defines how elements are wrapped
It consists of margin, border, padding, and content
It is used only for positioning elements
Frontend.answer: It consists of margin, border, padding, and content

Frontend.question: What is the difference between `id` and `class` in CSS?
options: id is unique, class can be used multiple times
id can be used multiple times, class is unique
id is used only for JavaScript
Frontend.answer: id is unique, class can be used multiple times

Frontend.question: What are the different types of positioning in CSS?
Explain the Virtual DOM in React.
options: A direct copy of the actual DOM
A lightweight JavaScript representation of the real DOM
Frontend.answer: A lightweight JavaScript representation of the real DOM

Frontend.question: What is the difference between `props` and `state` in React?
options: Props are immutable, state is mutable
Props are mutable, state is immutable
Only class components can use props
Frontend.answer: Props are immutable, state is mutable

Frontend.question: What is the purpose of React hooks?
options: To use state and lifecycle features in function components
Frontend.answer: To use state and lifecycle features in function components

Frontend.question: What is the significance of the `useEffect` hook?
options: To perform side effects in functional components
Frontend.answer: To perform side effects in functional components

Backend.answer: To enable communication between different software applications

options: To handle HTTP requests and responses

Backend.question: What is JWT (JSON Web Token) used for?
options: User authentication and secure data exchange
Backend.answer: User authentication and secure data exchange

Backend.question: What is the difference between synchronous and asynchronous programming?
options: Synchronous executes code line by line, asynchronous does not wait for tasks to complete

Asynchronous programming is only used in JavaScript
Backend.answer: Synchronous executes code line by line, asynchronous does not wait for tasks to complete

options: To restrict users from accessing certain tables

Machine Learning.question: Which of the following is a type of unsupervised learning?
What is the purpose of the activation function in a neural network?
Which algorithm is best suited for classification problems?
What is overfitting in machine learning?
options: When the model performs well on training data but poorly on test data
When the model performs well on test data but poorly on training data
When the model ignores training data
When the model performs well on all datasets
Machine Learning.answer: When the model performs well on training data but poorly on test data

options: Bagging reduces variance, boosting reduces bias
Bagging is sequential, boosting is parallel
Machine Learning.answer: Bagging reduces variance, boosting reduces bias

Data Analytics.question: What is the difference between structured and unstructured data?
options: Structured data is organized in tables, unstructured data lacks a predefined format
Structured data is always large in volume
Unstructured data is only used for machine learning
Data Analytics.answer: Structured data is organized in tables, unstructured data lacks a predefined format

options: To standardize the range of values in the dataset

Data Analytics.question: What is the difference between correlation and causation?
options: Correlation shows a relationship, causation shows direct influence
Correlation is used only in machine learning
Data Analytics.answer: Correlation shows a relationship, causation shows direct influence

options: A data point that deviates significantly from other observations
A dataset with only numerical values
Data Analytics.answer: A data point that deviates significantly from other observations
